summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to American Express, demanding extensive financial records related to Ghislaine Maxwell and several associated entities. The subpoena is part of a federal criminal investigation into suspected felony violations, including 18 U.S.C. ยง 2423(a) (transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity). It includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as an individual for whom all financial records from American Express are being subpoenaed, along with several associated entities.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is authorizing the subpoena for Maxwell's financial records as part of a grand jury investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The date by which American Express is commanded to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested records.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The date the grand jury subpoena was issued to American Express by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

locations: 43 Butterfield Circle, El Paso, TX 79906 (American Express Subpoena Response Unit address)
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY (Grand Jury location)
26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY 10278 (FBI office for record delivery)
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The subpoena targets American Express records for Ghislaine Maxwell and entities including Terramar Project Inc., Ellmax LLC, Max Foundation, and Max Hotel Services Corp.
The investigation is for alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. ยง 2423(a), which relates to transportation of minors with intent to engage in criminal sexual activity.
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requests American Express not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve investigation confidentiality.
The requested records are extensive, covering credit card statements, wire transfers, identification documents, and online account access details.
The document confirms an active federal grand jury investigation into Maxwell's financial activities as of December 2019.
